description._content: Sets the geo data (latitude and longitude and, optionally, the accuracy level) for a photo. Before users may assign location data to a photo they must define who, by default, may view that information. Users can edit this preference at http://www.flickr.com/account/geo/privacy/. If a user has not set this preference, the API method will return an error.

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: photo_id
argument._content: The id of the photo to set location data for.

argument.name: lat
argument._content: The latitude whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

argument.name: lon
argument._content: The longitude whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

argument.name: accuracy
argument._content: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. Defaults to 16 if not specified.

argument.name: context
argument._content:
Context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. For example, you may wish to indicate that a photo was taken "indoors" or "outdoors".

The current list of context IDs is :

  • 0, not defined.
  • 1, indoors.
  • 2, outdoors.

The default context for geotagged photos is 0, or "not defined"

error._content: The photo id was either invalid or was for a photo not viewable by the calling user.
Some or all of the required arguments were not supplied.
The latitude argument failed validation.
The longitude argument failed validation.
The accuracy argument failed validation.
There was an unexpected problem setting location information to the photo.

error.message: User has not configured default viewing settings for location data.
error._content: Before users may assign location data to a photo they must define who, by default, may view that information. Users can edit this preference at http://www.flickr.com/account/geo/privacy/

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
